item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:231155”][quote author=army_life link=topic=304112.msg2440197#msg2440197 date=1221423294]
Just because its 7 years ago (3 days ago) does not mean you need to be a fucking jackass thousands of people died that day that’s what we are remembering whether it was a inside job or not, how would you like it if your Mom or dad or someone close to you goes to work and does not come home and you hear he/she was at work on the top of a building that had a fire and was trapped or someone you care about would you want people making fun of you what im saying is my friends uncle died on 9/11 and I think its really disrespectful to be making jokes of it its a serious matter…
[/quote]

Oh so if your family didn’t die in 11/9 then they are still living/dead but shouldn’t care about them because they didn’t die on top of a burning building?

People lose family all the time you ignorant twat, America can’t rule the world for everything you know.[/quote]
But America does rule the world fag!

Nomsain, strongest army.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:231087”][quote author=Gotta Catch Them All link=topic=304112.msg2439497#msg2439497 date=1221389524]
3:53 is just surreal watching.
[/quote]
I paused it when the plane was like half way through the building… Weird how it didn’t appear to have caused any damage until the whole plane was in.[/quote]

If you look closely, you see that it did damage the building. The building was strong enough to sustain a direct hit from a plane. It wasn’t strong enough to sustain an explosion, especially one from the inside.

I don’t understand why the youtube poster is called 911conspiracy, as these videos clearly show that it was caused by a plane.

I really don’t see why people think the government did it. Oil? No, then they would blame a country like Saudi Arabia. Afghanistan doesn’t have anything that can repay the costs of the rebuild of Ground Zero.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Only for the rest of the world.

Nobody has a problem with people paying tribute to 9/11 (lol, I’ve been Americanised). However I find it rather annoying when some Americans expect the rest of the world to mourn with them, year in year out.
The American players of a game recently held a ceasefire to pay their respects, which is fine. The only problem is that they expected the rest of the world to take part too.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Its great to have respect for such a tragic event on its anniversary and all, but this is not the place to do it. Most of the members that visit this site are heartless and don’t care about anyone or anything but themselves (and no, I am not going to get into the argument that every one of our actions is a result of selfishness). Respect 911, but don’t do it where people’s care of others is virtually nothing.
